p.span: Paper pencil work – It is very important to stay current on your assignments and turn them in weekly to be graded. This is not the time to get behind on assignments. The school year is quickly coming to a close and the amount of time you have to complete assignments is also getting shorter.

A note about grades on paper/pencil work…Grades are a week behind on paper/pencil assignment being posted to ProgressBook. This is due to the fact that the district quarantines the papers for five days before distributing them to teachers to be graded.

It is also extremely important to be checking Schoology and submitting assignments on time. Dr. Noeth asked me to mention that there are too many students who have “Incompletes” in ProgressBook at the high school. There are two reasons for the “Incomplete” grade. Students either have missing assignments or they are failing the class. It is important to remember that students have until May 4 to correct the incomplete grade. After May 4, the incomplete will become a letter grade.
That concludes the updates for this week. Please continue to be safe. Thank you and Go Chiefs!

a.title: COVID-19
a.style: color: rgb(29, 29, 29); text-decoration-line: none; font-size: 16px; font-family: latoregular;

div.style: text-align: right;

div.div: Children who will be five years old on or before August 1, 2020 are eligible to attend kindergarten during the 2020-2021 school year. Parents are encouraged to register an eligible child by calling Bellefontaine Elementary at 599-4331 before March 20, 2020. Registration notices are being sent home with elementary school children and with children attending local pre-school programs. Additional notices are available at each school. READ MORE...

Children can be especially susceptible to the dangers associated with winter weather. Their youthful enthusiasm often takes over when common sense and safety should prevail. We encourage all our families and students to stay inform of winter weather and school closing by listening to daily reports on local radio, television, our district call systems and website. READ MORE...

Nominations are currently being accepted for the Bellefontaine High School 2020 Distinguished Alumni Award. This award has been established to honor alumni whose actions and achievements bring honor and distinction to the academic heritage of Bellefontaine High School. READ MORE...

Registration for all students in grades K-12 is done at our elementary school office. The office is located at: Bellefontaine Elementary School 1001 Ludlow Road Bellefontaine, Ohio, 43311 Phone: (937) 599-4331 Fax: (937) 599-3362 Please ask for elementary secretary, Pam Patton. READ MORE...

These immunizations are required for school attendance by law under the Ohio Revised Code section 3313.67 and 3313.671. Your family physician, local pharmacy, or the Logan County Health District can complete these immunizations. READ MORE...
Logan County will begin offering the Dolly Parton Imagination Library to all families with children age birth to five starting January of 2017. READ MORE...
